title.narrative: Increased DRR & CCA resilience in PAK.

description.narrative: The project aims to develop the Disaster risk reduction status report of the Pakistan through different consultation with the provincial and national level. The relevant stakeholder will be involved through different meetings, interviews and consultativeprocess. The report will be shared with the NDMA which will be presented in Asian Ministerial Conference on DRR to be held in Delhi. The other significant output is focused on the research which is on mainstreaming Disaster Risk Reduction. The integration of DRR and CCA into the Agriculture sector in Pakistan, an analysis of the current context and a review of options are required. Review will serve toassist NDMA, the provincial agriculture departments, Provincial Disaster Management Authorities (PDMAs)and relevant national institutions as well as the development partners in supporting the integration of DRR and CCA in the agriculture sector. The study involves both a desk review of relevant documentation (Acts, manuals, handbooks, project management documentation, legislation, plans etc.)and interview with key agencies and bodies engaged in the Agriculture sector. The activities under the research will be conducted multi stakeholder workshops to finalize the DRR/CCA mainstreaming action plans, development of handbook on mainstreaming DRR and CCA into agricultural sector development planning and training of the government participants from different provinces. The project willengage the different district and provincial and national level stakeholders in consultative workshop

participating-org.narrative:
Doaba Foundation is an operational organization that works with communities at grass root level. Doaba Foundation is working since 1997, a not-for-profit, humanitarian organization, registered as a Public Welfare Trust. A Board of Trustees, which consists of 07 members, manages Doaba Foundation. At field level a full time committed team implement projects under the facilitation of programme coordinators and executive coordinator to materialize Doaba’s goal.
Daoba vision is that Flood Disaster Prone Communities Become Self-reliant in Pursuit of their Common Interests.
And defines its mission: to improve the quality of life among rural people (particularly women and children) and, true to its name, concentrates on communities prone to flood disasters. It believes in achieving the goal through optimal utilization of available resources: physical-biological, moral and human. It seeks to build capacity of such communities incorporating even the relief activities into programmes of preparedness intervention, facilitating Emergence of self-reliant Communities.
Daoba has been a partner of Oxfam various Oxfams in Pakistan. Since 2005, Doaba and Oxfam Novib have been engaged as partners. The major thematic areas of partnership remained around building institutional capacities for emergency response. Doaba is one of the OI Consortium Members of OI Contingency Plan and has remained within OI system since 2003. Currently Doaba is managing three projects of (1) capacity building, (2) DRR work funded by Oxfam Canada through Oxfam Novib and (3) since 2009 the EC Food Facility Project - Facility for rapid response to soaring food prices in developing countries' jointly funded by EU and Oxfam Novib.
Projects in which Daoba has been/is involved: - Sustainable Livelihood, Development Interventions in Disaster Prone Area of TehsilLayyah - Community Based Disaster Risk Management in disaster prone areas of Muzaffargarh - Community Based Flood Preparedness in Southern Punjab - Gift Unwrap, with Disaster prone communities/Riverine Communities in Muzaffargarh, Jhang and Layyah Districts, Pakistan, - The WASH project, in the same area - Finally Dabo is also involved in the project "Construction of government school buildings" in Layyah.
